burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.common

Class PolicyGlyphPainter2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.singleagent.auxiliary.valuefunctionvis.common.PolicyGlyphPainter2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StatePolicyPainter

    public class PolicyGlyphPainter2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements StatePolicyPainter
    An class for rendering the policy for states by painting different glyphs for different actions. There are three different ways to paint the policy: (1) just painting the glyph for the most likely action (and all that tie as the most likely); (2) glyphs for all actions whose likelihood is within some threshold of the most likely action; (3) glyphs for all actions with the glyphs scaled by how likely the action is.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PolicyGlyphPainter2D.PolicyGlyphRenderStyle
      MAXACTION paints only glphys for only those actions that have the highest likelihood
      MAXACTIONSOFTTIE paints the glyphs for all actions whose likelihood is within some threshold of the most likely action
      DISTSCALED paints glyphs for all actions and scales them by the likelihood of the action

      The max probability difference from the most likely action for which an action that is not the most likely will still be rendered under the MAXACTIONSOFTTIE rendering style.
